intro: Baphia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian baphia, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are used in traditional medicine. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical contexts.
